A Spring service that proxies HTTP requests to external integrated tools, handling authentication, URL resolution, and request forwarding with comprehensive error handling and logging.

## Key Components

- **proxyApiRequest()** - Main entry point that validates tools and proxies incoming HTTP requests
- **buildApiRequestHeaders()** - Constructs request headers with authentication (API key, Bearer token, or none)
- **proxy()** - Executes the HTTP request to the target service and returns the response
- **createHttpRequest()** - Factory method for creating Apache HTTP client request objects
- **createHttpClient()** - Configures HTTP client with timeouts and connection settings

## Usage Example

```java
@Autowired
private RestProxyService restProxyService;

// Proxy a request to an external tool
public ResponseEntity<String> handleToolRequest(
    @PathVariable String toolId,
    HttpServletRequest request,
    @RequestBody String body) {
    
    return restProxyService.proxyApiRequest(toolId, request, body);
}

// The service handles:
// - Tool validation and enablement checks
// - URL resolution through ProxyUrlResolver
// - Authentication header injection
// - HTTP method mapping (GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, OPTIONS)
// - Response forwarding with original status codes
```

The service supports multiple authentication types (header-based API keys and Bearer tokens), includes comprehensive logging at INFO and DEBUG levels, and provides robust error handling with appropriate HTTP status codes for various failure scenarios.
